result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:20 PM 22CF37/22TR187 - Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jeremy K. Oxberger.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ocwieja waives the preliminary hearing. JO concurs.  Court binds over for trial. 

Attorney Ocwieja speaks that they are trying to get his client into drug court. Attorney Harper will be filing the information bring forth the same charges. Attorney Ocwieja waives the formal reading and stands mute to all counts. Max penalties stated.

22TR187- Attorney McGough asks if the registration was done. JO states that he has gotten everything taken care of.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Determination of Non-Eligibility for Treatment Court

11:04 AM 22CF37/22TR187 - Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Jeremy K. Oxberger. Attorney Ocwieja states that he believes today was a status on treatment court. Attorney Ocwieja needs to apply to the Sauk County Treatment court and believes they should have an answer within two to three weeks. Attorney Harper concurs.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on June 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

While the case is pending, Defendant to pay $50/month to the Clerk of Court, first payment due 05/01/22. At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk

12:51 PM  22CF37/22TR187 - Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the right to get counsel. Defendant indicates that he doesn't qualify for the public defenders. Defendant hasn't looked into getting an attorney but would like a court appointed attorney.

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Ocwieja. Defendant to deposit $50/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 05/01/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court. 

Initial appearance scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

for April 12, 2022 at 1 PM

03/18/22: JO was notified of the hearing date change by phone from the clerk.

Appearances: Judge Vandehey, AK Court Reporter, ADA Forehand for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney McDougal

Recommendation on bail from the State :
$2,500 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Defense/Defendant comments:
Attorney McDougal asks for a signature bond instead of a cash bond or a lower cash bond.
JO doesn't qualify for a public defender.

Court Orders:
$1,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Next Appearance set for March 22, 2022 at 1 PM
